Kitakichine, Ozi[CR]Wizard : Andy[CR]System modernize : Nakatsuka, Zen[CR]Enemy's brain : Hirokun, Nishino[CR]Tool engineer : Pierre[CR]Sound : Hiyamuta (Hiya!), Captain Beroou (as Bero-ou)[CR]Producer : Takashi Nishiyama[CR]Exec. producer : Yoshihiko Kodo[CR]Hyper organizer : Eikichi Kawasaki[CR][B]Game Ports[/B][CR]* Consoles :[CR]SNK Neo-Geo [JP] (May 27, 1999; "Metal Slug X - Super Vehicle-001 [Model NGH-250]")[CR]Sony PlayStation [JP] (Jan. 25, 2001; "Metal Slug X - Super Vehicle-001 [Model SLPM-86456]")[CR]Sony PlayStation [JP] (July 25, 2002; "Metal Slug X - Super Vehicle-001 [SNK Best Collection] [Model SLPS-03449]")[CR]Sony PSP [JP] (Feb. 22, 2006; "Metal Slug Complete [Model ULJS-00090]")[CR]Sony PlayStation 2 [JP] (May 31, 2007; "Metal Slug Complete [Model SLPS-25762]")[CR]Nintendo Wii [JP] (Dec. 27, 2007; "Metal Slug Complete [Model RVL-RMLJ-JPN]")[CR]Sony PlayStation 2 [JP] (June 18, 2009; "Metal Slug Complete [SNK Best Collection] [Model SLPS-25937]")[CR]Sony PSP [JP] (June 18, 2009; "Metal Slug Complete [SNK Best Collection] [Model ULJS-00206]")[CR]Nintendo Wii [EU] [Virtual Console] (September 13, 2012)[CR]* Computers :[CR]PC DVD-ROM (2009, "Metal Slug Collection PC")[CR]

game.name: Mutation Nation (NGM-014 ~ NGH-014)
game.plot: Mutation Nation (c) 1992 SNK [Shin Nihon Kikaku].[CR]Two lone warriors with an array of special mutant powers attempt to restore order to this futuristic wasteland.[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID : NGM-014[CR][SNK MVS Neo-Geo Controls][CR]2 Players - 4 Buttons Per Player (2 usables)[CR]=> [A] Attack/Special Attack [B] Jump[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]Mutation Nation was released in March 1992.[CR][B]Tips and Tricks[/B][CR]The game includes different items which change the special attack :[CR]* A : Spirit attack[CR]* B : Explosion attack[CR]* C : Thunder god's attack[CR]* D : Tornado attack[CR]* Golden : Deathblow (can be used only one time, after this the item disappears)[CR][B]Staff[/B][CR]Producer : Eikichi Kawasaki[CR]Planner : Ishimotti[CR]Programmer : Ooisaurus[CR]Sound : Masahiko Hataya (Papaya)[CR]Designers : Mioshi, Yokosuka!!, A. Miyazaki, 1610,last!!, Sk, Yumo, Tajiyan, J. Mikami[CR]Special Thanks : Takashi Nishiyama (Nishiyama), Tama, Y. O, Yuki, Akira Goto, Jojoha Kitapy (Jojouha Kitapy)[CR][B]Game Ports[/B][CR]* Consoles :[CR]SNK Neo-Geo CD [JP] April 17, 1992; "Mutation Nation [Model NGH-014]"[CR]SNK Neo-Geo CD [US] April 17, 1992; "Mutation Nation [Model NGH-014]"[CR]SNK Neo-Geo CD [JP] February 25, 1995; "Mutation Nation [Model NGCD-014]"[CR]SNK Neo-Geo CD [US] February 25, 1995; "Mutation Nation [Model NGCD-014E]"[CR]

game.name: NAM-1975 (NGM-001 ~ NGH-001)
game.plot: NAM-1975 (c) 1990 SNK [Shin Nihon Kikaku].[CR]One or two players take control of 2 machine-gun carrying Vietnam vets who must shoot their way through a number of sideways scrolling, Vietnam-themed levels. the players shoot into the screen and aiming is achieved via the use an on-screen target, which each player directs to lock on to the various enemy troops and vehicles. Players can run and somersault to avoid the incoming enemy fire.[CR]A number of more powerful weapons - such as grenades and flame throwers - are often dropped by the enemy and can be picked up and used. Bonus points are also revealed in this fashion.[CR]Nam-1975 is a blatant plagiarism of TAD Corp's "Cabal", released in September 1988. Cabal is easily the more accomplished of the two games.[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID : NGM-001[CR]Players: 2[CR]Control: 8-way joystick[CR]Buttons: 3[CR]=> [A] Machine gun, [B] Special weapon, [C] Run/Emergency control[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]NAM-1975 was released on April 26 1990 in Japan.[CR]This is the first game developed for the SNK Neo-Geo MVS hardware[CR]One of NAM-1975's influences was the 1987 Stanley Kubrick film, Full Metal Jacket. There are even some scenes which mirror the film such as the screaming soldier in the intro with the 'Born To Kill' helmet, and a Vietnamese lady with an AK-47 (which is seen near the end of the movie).[CR][B]Staff[/B][CR]Producer : Eikichi Kawasaki[CR]Main director : Dachipee[CR]Sub director : Fukupee (New Face)[CR]Programmer : ZAC, Kurasan (New Face)[CR]Design chief : Satopee[CR]Designers : Nakapee, Fukupee, Satopee, Ishipee, Miyopee, Kawapee (New Face), Sakapee (New Face), Yamapee (New Face)[CR]Sound : Yoko. O[CR]Hard : Fukusan[CR][B]Game Ports[/B][CR]* Consoles :[CR]SNK Neo-Geo [JP] (July 1, 1991, "NAM-1975 [Model NGH-001]")[CR]SNK Neo-Geo [US] (July 1, 1991, "NAM-1975 [Model NGH-001]")[CR]SNK Neo-Geo CD [JP] (September 9, 1994, "NAM-1975 [Model NGCD-001]")[CR]SNK Neo-Geo CD [US] (September 9, 1994, "NAM-1975 [Model NGCD-001E]")[CR]

game.name: Ninja Combat (NGM-009)
game.plot: Ninja Combat (c) 1990 Alpha Denshi Company, Limited. [CR]The ninja castle must be invaded! After you defeat certain boss enemies, they become playable characters as well![CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID: NGM-009[CR]Players: 2[CR]Control: 8-Way Joystick[CR]Buttons: 3[CR]=> [A] Attack/Super Attack, [B] Jump, [C] Special[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]Ninja Combat was released in July 1990.[CR][B]Tips and Tricks[/B][CR]By holding the A button until the attack gauge reaches full and then releasing it, you can unleash a burst of magical energy that can affect many of the enemies on screen. However, this has an effect similar to what happens in Final Fight: when you use this power, it decreases some of your life gauge.[CR]By pressing the C button and then the A button, you can perform a special somersault attack that can be used to knock down a couple enemies in a row.[CR]Only the main 2 players, Joe and Hayabusa, can pick up special weapons like swords, hachets and maces. The other 3 players (Musashi, Kagerow, and Gembu), who become selectable after appearing as sub-bosses, do not. To let go of a special weapon that you've picked up, press the B button.[CR][B]Staff[/B][CR]Producer & Director : Tsutomu Maruyama[CR]Programmers : Eiji Fukatsu, Hideo Kamoda, Yukinori Nishikata, Teruaki Shirasawa[CR]Character Designers : Hatsue Honbe, Kazushige Hakamata, Shinji Moriyama[CR]Scroll Designers : Tsutomu Maruyama, Mitsunari Ishida, Kenichi Sakanishi[CR]Music Composers & Sound Effects : Hideki Yamamoto, Hiroaki Shimizu[CR]Special Thanks : Yukio Gotoh, Yuka Watanabe, Akira Ushizawa[CR][B]Game Ports[/B][CR]* Consoles :[CR]SNK Neo-Geo [JP] (July 1, 1991, "Ninja Combat [Model NGH-009]")[CR]SNK Neo-Geo [US] (July 1, 1991, "Ninja Combat [Model NGH-009]")[CR]SNK Neo-Geo CD [JP] (October 31, 1994, "Ninja Combat [Model ADCD-101]")[CR]Sony Playstation 2 [JP] (December 18, 2008, "ADK Tamashii [Model SLPS-25906]")[CR]Nintendo Wii [JP] (May 27, 2008, "Virtual Console") [Model EAMJ][CR]Nintendo Wii [US] (June 2, 2008, "Virtual Console") [Model EAME][CR]Nintendo Wii [EU] (June 13, 2008, "Virtual Console") [Model EAMP][CR]Nintendo Wii [AU] (June 13, 2008, "Virtual Console")[CR]

game.name: Ninja Commando
game.plot: Ninja Commando (c) 1992 Alpha Denshi Company, Limited.[CR]3 ninjas are sent on a mission to stop a madman named Spider from trying to use a time machine to mess with history. The game is almost like a tongue-in-cheek reworking of "Time Soldiers", which Alpha Denshi made 5 years earlier, with ninjas as the protagonists this time.[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID: NGM-050[CR]Players: 2[CR]Control: 8-Way Joystick[CR]Buttons: 3[CR]=> [A] Shoot, [B] Somersault, [C] Ninja Tricks[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]Ninja Commando was released on April 30, 1992.[CR][B]Tips and Tricks[/B][CR]The more you press the A button repeatedly, the more firepower you'll produce.[CR]Press the A and B button together to fire shuri-ken (star-shaped blades). Unlike the main firepower, which is only straight ahead, the shuri-ken can be fired in all directions by moving the joystick in the opposite direction of which you wish to aim (example : to fire to the left, move the joystick to right and vice versa). This is also the best way to deal with a few of the bosses here : for example, on the stage set in feudal Japan, there are two giant sumo wrestlers who appear as sub-bosses. The main firepower seems to only have minor effect on them, but the shuri-ken are much more effective.[CR]The C button is for firing magical bursts of energy. One drawback is that, similar to "Final Fight" this can cause a little of your life energy to be drained, so it should be used very carefully.[CR][B]Staff[/B][CR]Producer: Tsutomu Maruyama[CR]Director: Tsutomu Maruyama[CR]Executive Producer : Kazuo Arai[CR]Director Of Software : Eiji Fukatsu[CR]System programmers : Makio Chiba, Satoshi Okada (SNK)[CR]Programmers : Ryu Hiroyuki, Yuji Noguchi[CR]Character Designers : Tsutomu Maruyama, Shinji Moriyama (as Sinji Moriyama), Takashi Hatono, Hidemi Nagatomo, Hideyuki Kusano[CR]Music Composer : Yuka Watanabe[CR][B]Game Ports[/B][CR]* Consoles :[CR]SNK Neo-Geo [JP] (May 29, 1992; "Ninja Commando [Model NGH-050]")[CR]SNK Neo-Geo [US] (May 29, 1992; "Ninja Commando [Model NGH-050]")[CR]SNK Neo-Geo CD [JP] (October 31, 1994; "Ninja Commando [Model ADCD-004]")[CR]Sony PlayStation 2 [JP] (December 18, 2008; "ADK Tamashii [Model SLPS-25906]")[CR]Nintendo Wii [Virtual Console] [JP] (June 24, 2008; "Ninja Commando [Model EAPJ]")[CR]Nintendo Wii [Virtual Console] [US] (July 11, 2008; "Ninja Commando [Model EAPE]")[CR]Nintendo Wii [Virtual Console] [AU] (July 11, 2008; "Ninja Commando)[CR]Nintendo Wii [Virtual Console] [EU] (July 14, 2008; "Ninja Commando [Model EAPP]")[CR]

game.name: Neo Bomberman
game.plot: Neo Bomber Man (c) 1997 Hudson Soft.[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID: 0093[CR]Players: 2[CR]Control: 8-way joystick[CR]Buttons: 1[CR]=> [A] Bomb set/Kick bomb/Throw bomb[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]Neo Bomber Man was released in May 1997 in Japan.[CR]This game runs on the Neo-Geo MVS but was not released on the Neo-Geo AES home console.[CR][B]Game Series[/B][CR]1. Bomber Man (1984, MSX)[CR]2. Bomber Man (1985, Famicom)[CR]3. Bomber Man Special (1986, MSX)[CR]4. Bomber Man (1990, Famicom Disk System)[CR]5. Bomber Man (1991, Arcade)[CR]6. Bomber Man II [Model HFC-2X] (1991, Famicom)[CR]7. Bomber Man World (1992, Arcade)[CR]8. Bomber Man '93 [Model HC92061] (1992, PC-Engine)[CR]9. game.name: Neo-Geo Cup '98 - The Road to the Victory
game.description: Neo-Geo Cup '98 - The Road to the Victory
game.title_clean: Neo-Geo Cup '98 - The Road to the Victory
game.plot: NeoGeo Cup '98 - The Road to the Victory (c) 1998 SNK.[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID: NGM-244[CR]Players: 2[CR]Control: 8-way joystick[CR]Buttons: 3[CR]=> Attack > [A] Shoot/Low pass, [B] High pass, [C] Short pass[CR]=> Defense > [A] Sliding, [B] Rough play/Tackle, [C] Action player shift[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]NeoGeo Cup '98 was released in May 1998. It was actually a hack of "Super Sidekicks 3" made by SNK themselves. His subtitle is a homage for "Fatal Fury 3 - Road to the Final Victory"[CR]A serious bug: Using a USA bios rom if you insert a coin on the 'winners don't use drugs' screen on a single slot the games will use the neogeo bios s1 tileset rather than the game tiles, this causes most of the graphics to be hidden and the games to be unplayable, it will also end up using the mainboard z80 bios so sound will be broken, the games should fix themselves if you let them run another attract loop after gameover, on a multi-slot the games will reset. This is one of the first 4 'gigapower' games, the bug was fixed after that.[CR][B]Tips and Tricks[/B][CR]* View The Name List : At title screen hold A+B+C and press Start to begin.[CR]* Each team has 0, 1, 2, or 3 strengths. It stands to reason that the best team will probably have 3 strengths, unless you like an unusual combination like attack & defense. Here are the 16 teams that have 3 strengths : Croatia, Nigeria, Italy, France, Holland, Brazil, Argentina, England, Germany, Spain, Denmark, Colombia, Mexico, Romania, Portugal, Yugoslavia[CR][B]Game Series[/B][CR]1. Tokuten Oh [Model NGM-052] (1992)[CR]2. Tokuten Oh 2 - Real Fight Football [Model NGM-061] (1994)[CR]3. Tokuten Oh 3 - Eikoue no Michi [Model NGM-081] (1995)[CR]4. The Ultimate 11 - SNK Football Championship [Model NGM-215] (1996)[CR]5. NeoGeo Cup '98 - The Road to the Victory [Model NGM-244] (1998)[CR][B]Staff[/B][CR]President : Eikichi Kawasaki[CR]Director : H. Kawano[CR]Planners : SNK R&D Center, Fighting Shooter[CR]Chief programmer : Uzumasa SeVEN[CR]Main programmers : EJ2OWRX, Yuritaro[CR]Programmer : Toppo George[CR]Sound : Ackey, Pearl Shibakichi[CR]Designers : Kanitoru, Performaru, Shio Shio Shio(c), Gow Travolta, Daisy "Tateko", Toooooooooohru, Nelson Pigu, Tenuking, Blendy Cop, Lisa-Nari, Silicone Grown, Kaoline[CR]Models : Tom Powell, Bug Stopper (Bug Stoper), H. Kawano, Mic-Senbey, Love&Soul, Gow Travolta, Daisy "Tateko", Tenuking, Performaru-2, George. Y, Tom Karji, J. Miki, GC8-WRX, Jichoh Ninomiya[CR][B]Game Ports[/B][CR]* Consoles :[CR]SNK Neo-Geo [JP] (July 30, 1998; "NeoGeo Cup '98 - The Road to the Victory [Model NGH-244]")[CR]SNK Neo-Geo Pocket [JP] (Oct. 28, 1998; "NeoGeo Cup '98 - The Road to the Victory [Model NEOP00020]")[CR]SNK Neo-Geo Pocket Color [JP] (Apr. 15, 1998; "NeoGeo Cup '98 Plus - The Road to the Victory [Model NEOP00390]")[CR]

game.name: Neo-Geo
game.plot: Neo-Geo MVS (c) 1990 SNK Corp.[CR]A cartridge-based arcade system board. The MVS stands for Multi Video System, and as its name suggest, offers owners the ability to put up to six different arcade titles into a single cabinet, a key economic consideration for operators with limited floorspace. With its games stored on self-contained cartridges, a game cabinet can be exchanged for a different game title by swapping the game's ROM-cartridge and cabinet artwork.[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Main CPU: Motorola 68000 (@ 12 Mhz)[CR]Sound CPU: Zilog Z80 (@ 4 Mhz)[CR]Sound Chips: Yamaha YM2610 (@ 8 Mhz)[CR]TOTAL RAM: 214 KB.[CR]- Main Motorola 68000 RAM: 64 KB (32 KB x2).[CR]- Video RAM: 84 KB.[CR]-- Main VRAM: 64 KB (32 KB x2)[CR]-- Palette memory: 16 KB (8 KB x2)[CR]-- Fast video sprite RAM: 4 KB (2 KB x2)[CR]- Zilog Z80 Sound RAM: 2 KB.[CR]- Battery-backup save NVRAM: 64 KB.[CR]On-board ROM: 512 KB[CR]- Zoom look-up table: 128 KB[CR]- Fix layer graphics: 128 KB[CR]- Zilog Z80 sound: 128 KB[CR]- Motorola 68000 BIOS: 128 KB[CR]Display resolution: 320×224 px (many games only use the centermost 304 px)[CR]Color palette: 65,536 (16-bit) (not RGB565, but RGB666, where the lowest bit of each channel is shared with one bit)[CR]Maximum colors on screen: 4096 (12-bit)[CR]Maximum sprites on screen: 380[CR]Minimum sprite size: 1x2 px[CR]Maximum sprite size: 16x512 px[CR]Maximum sprites per scanline: 96[CR]Simultaneous scroll planes: 3[CR]Aspect ratio: 4:3[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]Released on April 26, 1990 in Japan, the same day as the Neo-Geo AES console.[CR]MVS stand for 'Multi Video System', Neo-Geo means 'New World'.[CR]

Mr. Do! (1982)[CR]2. Mr. Do's Castle (1983)[CR]3. Mr. Do's Wild Ride (1984)[CR]4. Do! Run Run (1984)[CR]5. Neo Mr. Do! (1996)[CR]

game.name: Ninja Master's - Haoh-ninpo-cho
game.plot: Ninja Master''s ～覇王忍法帖～ (c) 1996 SNK[CR](Ninja Master's Haoh Ninpou Chou)[CR]Criminally overlooked and combo-friendly medieval Japanese fighter with great animation. Ten selectable characters and two end bosses.[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID : 217[CR]Main CPU : Motorola 68000 (@ 12 Mhz)[CR]Sound CPU : Zilog Z80 (@ 4 Mhz)[CR]Sound Chips : Yamaha YM2610 (@ 8 Mhz)[CR]Players : 2[CR]Control : 8-way joystick[CR]Buttons : 4[CR]=> [A] Light Punch, [B] Strong Punch, [C] Light Kick, [D] Strong Kick[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]Ninja Master's Haoh Ninpou Chou was released in May 1996.[CR]The subtitle of this game translates from Japanese as 'Supreme Ninja Arts Scroll'.[CR]The main design, as well as some of the special moves of the character 'Karasu' seem to be quite inspired by the main character of the 1994 movie hit 'The Crow' which was in turn, based on the graphical novel of the same name by James O. Barr (Even the name 'Karasu' stands as the Japanese word for "crow"!). :)[CR]The character 'Nobunaga' is based on the real Japanese warrior 'Nobunaga Oda' who, during Japan's medieval period, overthrew the Ashikaga shogunate and ended a long period of internal strife by uniting half of Japan's provinces under his rule. In doing so he paved the way for the reunification of the country under the Tokugawa shogunate in the following century. His merciless use of power as well as his skill as a military strategist made him one of the most powerful & feared leaders in Japan. The image of him in the game as a warrior who wields the demons power may have been some sort of a criticism to his eager embrace of Western culture, religion & technology.[CR]The character 'Goemon' is based on Ishikawa Goemon, the most famous thief in Japan on the Edo era (about 400 years ago) known to steal large sums of money from bad people and give the money to the poor. In other words, he was Japan's very own version of Robin Hood![CR]The character 'Sasuke' seems inspired on Sarutobi Sasuke, a famous legendary ninja with a strong sense of justice created in Tachikawa literature at the end of the Meiji period. Another source of inspiration may have been 'Ninja Kamui' an old anime series whose main character Kamui was an incredibly skilled ninja who wanted to abandon his ways as a killer thus becoming a 'nukenin' (runaway ninja) and marked for death by his own clan that vows to pursue and eliminate him.[CR]Sountrack releases :[CR][JP] Ninja Master's Haoh Ninpou Chou - G.S.M 1500 Series - PCCB-00209, March 21, 1996, Pony Canyon / Scitron[CR][B]Tips and Tricks[/B][CR]* Play As Ranmaru And Nobunaga (Player 1) : Highlight Kamui and press Left, Down, Left, Up, Left, Down, Left, Up, Right, Down, Right, Up and hit C+D.[CR]* Play As Ranmaru And Nobunaga (Player 2) : Highlight Sasuke and press Right, Down, Right, Up, Right, Down, Right, Up, Left, Down, Left, Up and hit C+D.[CR]* Time Attack Mode : At the character select screen, highlight Kamui and press Down, Left, Up, Left, Down, Left, Up, Left, Down, Right(x4), Up, C+D. Now choose your character.[CR]* Successfully complete the game with a single credit within 8:30:00 minutes and the game shows you how to execute your character's 'finisher' move![CR][B]Staff[/B][CR]Developed by ADK.[CR]Producer & Planner : Hiroyuki Toda[CR]Chief Planner : Kazuhiro Shibata[CR]Planners : Visitor Y. Oni, M. Honda[CR]System Programmers : Eiji Fukatsu, Makio Chiba[CR]Sound Programmer : Makio Chiba[CR]Desgin Tool Programmer : Ryu Hiroyuki[CR]Total Adviser : Kenichi Sakanishi[CR]Chief Programmer -Main- Program : Teruaki Shirasawa[CR]-Demo- Program : Maichikin[CR]Chief Sprite Designer : Kazushige Hakamata[CR]Sprite Designers : Gensan, Hideyuki Yamada, Yokoo, Muneki Shiraishi, Hiroshi Ohzono, Tohru Okamura, West-Maison, Takahiro Arahata, Mitsugu. T, Shigechi, Ruc, Hirotaka Orita, Syoichi Satoh, H. Hasegawa-CRM, Kei Kuramochi, Hitoshi Aoki, Ben, Yukari Shinozaki[CR]Scroll Designers : Shinji Moriyama (Sinji Moriyama), Masako Sato, Kaori Kumagai, Kazunori Uchiumi[CR]Demo Designers : Masato Mitsuya, Sinku[CR]Sound : Hiroaki Kujirai, Yuka Watanabe, Hiroaki Shimizu, Takeshi Muramatsu[CR]Sound Effect : Hiroaki Kujirai (Kujirai Type-02)[CR]* Character Voices :[CR]Sasuke : Kabao Kikkawa[CR]Tenho : Shinobu Sekimoto[CR]Kamui, Raiga, Unzen : Masahiko Yano[CR]Natsume, Narration : Mayumi Minoda[CR]Kasumi : Masami Katou[CR]Goemon : T. Mukaiyama[CR]Houoh : Yoshikatsu Fujio[CR]Karasu : Kouichi Koba[CR]Ranmaru : Yasue Ishii[CR]Nobunaga : Masao Harada[CR]Market Research : Yukio Gotoh (Yukio Gotou)[CR]Public Information : Taguchi-1, Satsuki Ito, Sugiyama Kiyotaka, Kayo Yamagata[CR]Quality Controls : Nagata Shogatsu, Masao Tachikawa, Sugiyama Kiyotaka, Takagi, Uma[CR]Special Thanks : Tomobe Seijin, Studio Bihou[CR]Executive Producer : Kazuo Arai[CR]BGM : Back Of My Mind, Hiroaki Kujirai[CR][B]Game Ports[/B][CR]* Consoles :[CR]SNK Neo-Geo [JP] (June 28, 1996) "Ninja Master's Haoh Ninpou Chou [Model NGH-012]"[CR]SNK Neo-Geo [US] (June 28, 1996) "Ninja Master's Haoh Ninpou Chou [Model NGH-217]"[CR]SNK Neo-Geo CD [JP] (September 27, 1996) "Ninja Master's Haoh Ninpou Chou [Model ADCD-012]"[CR]Sony Playstation 2 [JP] (December 18, 2008) "ADK Tamashii [Model SLPS-25906]"[CR]Nintendo Wii [JP] (July 26, 2011) "Virtual Console"[CR]

game.name: Nightmare in the Dark
game.plot: Nightmare in the Dark (c) 2000 Eleven / Gavaking.[CR]A peaceful (yet creepy looking!) gravekeeper embarks on a night-shift battle against zombies & other night dwellers in order to put an end to the grave robbing mystery before the local villagers panic! Features very nice graphics with cool backgrounds, great soundtrack & pretty fun gameplay in the same style as "Snow Bros. - Nick & Tom", "Tumble Pop" & "Zupapa!". The deceased must rest in peace, so be sure to remind them of this fact! :)[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID : 0260[CR]Main CPU : Motorola 68000 (@ 12 Mhz)[CR]Sound CPU : Zilog Z80 (@ 4 Mhz)[CR]Sound Chips : Yamaha YM2610 (@ 8 Mhz)[CR]Screen orientation : Horizontal[CR]Video resolution : 320 x 224 pixels[CR]Screen refresh : 59.19 Hz[CR]Palette Colors : 4096[CR]Players : 2[CR]Control : 8-way joystick[CR]Buttons : 3[CR]=> [A] Attack/Throw fireball, [B] Jump, [C] Attack/Throw fireball[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]Released in January 2000.[CR]This game runs on the Neo-Geo MVS but was not released on the Neo-Geo AES home console.[CR]The game forbids the initials 'SEX' on the high score table. If you try, it gets changed to 'KING'.[CR][B]Tips and Tricks[/B][CR]* Alternate Costumes : At the beginning of the game (work at the continue screen too), hold the folowing buttons and press Start to choose an alternate costume : A = Blue, B = Red, C = Green, D = Yellow, AB = Grey, CD = Purple, AC = Orange, BD = Black.[CR]* Shoot the treasure chests with fire and they will churn out lots and lots of diamonds until they disappear. As long as you do not get hit, the diamonds will continue to go up in value until they finally reach 10,000 each. Grabbing the sacks will add multipliers (2X, 4X, up to 8X) that will further increase your score.[CR]* There are many cracks in the wood/stone of most levels. Some of these will reveal a fireball that will make your shot fly all over the board. Experiment with throwing at different angles to find these hidden spots. Most will clear the entire board as the ball flings out of control.[CR][B]Staff[/B][CR]Programmer : Hisanori Takeuchi (AM FACTORY)[CR]Graphic designers : Hiroshi Yokoyama, Masayuki Taguchi, Tsuyoshi Yoneyama, Taketumi Watanabe (ELEVEN)[CR]Sound composer : Kim[CR]Data convert : Tatsuya Watanabe (PAON)[CR]Director : Akihiko Uto[CR]

Uchiumi, Kaori Kumagai[CR]Programmers : E-Chan, Donpei[CR]System Programmers : Makio Chiba, Hideo Kamoda[CR]Hard Engineer : Eiji Fukatsu[CR]Character Maker Programmer : Hiroyuki Ryu[CR]Sound Effects : Hideki Yamamoto[CR]Music : Takao Ohshima, Keiichiroh Segawa[CR]Public : Satsuki Itoh, Hajime Taguchi, Kiyotaka Sugiyama, Kayo Yamagata[CR]Director : Takashi Egashira[CR][B]Game Ports[/B][CR]* Consoles :[CR]SNK Neo-Geo [JP] (May 24, 1996, "Over Top [Model ADH-011]")[CR]SNK Neo-Geo CD (July 5, 1996, "Over Top [Model ADCD-011]")[CR]

game.name: Puzzle Bobble 2 / Bust-A-Move Again (Neo-Geo)
game.plot: Puzzle Bobble 2 (c) 1999 Taito Corp.[CR]MVS re-release. For more information about the game itself, please see the original "Puzzle Bobble 2" (Taito F3 version) entry.[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID : NGM-248[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]This game is known in North America as "Bust-A-Move Again [Model NGM-248]".[CR]Even though it is not shown on the title screen, the marquee and promotional fliers for the US version call the game "Bust-A-Move Again EX", which was probably used to differentiate from the original Taito F3 version released years earlier.[CR]The original US release of "Bust-A-Move Again" for the Taito F3 board removed all Puzzle Bobble style levels, story, characters and replaced Bub and Bob with generic human hands. However, this MVS port retains the original Puzzle Bobble 2 assets for the US release.[CR]This MVS version is a port from the 1995 version of "Puzzle Bobble 2" and is the first (and maybe the only at this time) port from 'coin-op to coin-op'![CR][B]Game Series[/B][CR]1. game.name: Pochi and Nyaa
game.plot: Pochi to Nyaa (c) 2003 Aiky.[CR]Pochi to Nyaa is a cutesy puzzle game where the objective is to match the colored invaders in chains much in the vein of the Sega game "Puyo Puyo Fever". Pochi to Nyaa features three different modes of play: story mode, vs. computer mode, and two player vs. mode.[CR]Story mode is a bare bones, single player game with three difficulty settings. The player works to build up chains in order to gain more time to play in one endless level. Once the timer runs out the game is over.[CR]Vs. Computer mode is more of a real story mode where the player takes on the role of the novice wizard Prim, who has foolishly been lured into the "Pochi and Nyaa Tournament" by the promises of pudding. Before each battle Prim engages her opponent in a brief dialogue in order to advance the storyline. The player advances to the next opponent after winning one round. If the player loses the round then it is game over.[CR]Vs. Player mode is a standard two player battle mode and begins with a character select screen. After the characters are selected there is a short dialogue to introduce the players' characters and then the battle begins. Whoever wins two round of gameplay is the victor. Unlike many other two player games, Pochi to Nyaa vs. mode is played on one credit and so once the winner is announced the game is over.[CR]In both single player mode games there is a brief introduction to the gameplay to assist the novice player.[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID : 0267[CR]Main CPU : Motorola 68000 (@ 12 Mhz), Zilog Z80 (@ 4 Mhz)[CR]Sound Chips : Yamaha YM2610 (@ 8 Mhz)[CR]Screen orientation : Horizontal[CR]Video resolution : 320 x 224 pixels[CR]Screen refresh : 59.19 Hz[CR]Palette colors : 4096[CR]Players : 2[CR]Control : 8-way Joystick[CR]Buttons : 3[CR]=> [A] Turn nyan counterclockwise, [B] Turn nyan clockwise, [C] Change fally nyan to spiky nyan[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]Released in December 2003.[CR]The game is known outside Japan as "Pochi and Nyaa".[CR]'Pochi' is a common name for a 'dog', and 'Nyaa' is the typical sound for a 'cat', so the title translates as 'Puppy and miaw'. The title is a pun : there is an extra char, so it can be read as 'Pochitto Nyaa', and Pochitto is the sound for a button quickly pressed.[CR]This game was out first out on the Sega Naomi hardware in 2002, and was ported to the SNK Neo-Geo MVS at the end of 2003 (but was not released on the Neo-Geo AES home console).[CR][B]Staff[/B][CR]Producer : Moo Niitani[CR]Sound Designer : Ichi, Moo Nya-Tani[CR]Instruction : Kashima Tadayuki[CR]Sound Produce : Tanaka Katumi[CR]Sound Direction and Design : Hayashi Kou (Oak-Sun Sound Design), Nagata Daisuke (Oak-Sun Sound Design), Hayashi Kou (Oak-Sun Sound Design), [CR]Voice Actor : Moo Nya-Tani, Kemi[CR]Development Cooperation : Oak-Sun Sound Design[CR][B]Game Ports[/B][CR]* Consoles :[CR]Sony PlayStation 2 (2004)[CR]

game.name: Pop 'n Bounce / Gapporin
game.plot: Pop 'n Bounce (c) 1997 Video System.[CR]A breakout-style game.[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID : 0237[CR]Main CPU : Motorola 68000 (@ 12 Mhz)[CR]Sound CPU : Zilog Z80 (@ 4 Mhz)[CR]Sound Chips : Yamaha YM2610 (@ 8 Mhz)[CR]Screen orientation : Horizontal[CR]Video resolution : 320 x 224 pixels[CR]Screen refresh : 59.19 Hz[CR]Palette colors : 4096[CR]Players : 2[CR]Control : dial[CR]Buttons : 3[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]This game is known in Japan as "Gappolin".[CR]This game runs on the Neo-Geo MVS but was not released on the Neo-Geo AES home console.[CR]The game forbids the initials 'SEX' on the high score table. If you try, it gets changed to 'NON'.[CR][B]Staff[/B][CR]Producer : Furukama[CR]Director : Nishikawa[CR]Manager : Shiomi[CR]Programmers : You-Chan, Gen[CR]Designers : Akira, Oh! Kawara, Tetsudai 6, T. Tateisi, Manbow., Yamoya[CR]Music composer : Naoki Sakamura (Nao Itamura)[CR]Sound effects : Pirowo, Norie[CR]Sound programmers : Mami, H. Soyama[CR]

game.name: Power Instinct (USA)
game.plot: Gouketsuji Ichizoku (c) 1993 Atlus.[CR]8 characters fight each other for control of Oume World, featuring great music and possibly THE coolest character of all time, Otane Goketuji![CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Main CPU : Motorola 68000 (@ 12 Mhz)[CR]Sound Chips : OKI6295 (@ 6 Khz)[CR]Screen orientation : Horizontal[CR]Video resolution : 320 x 224 pixels[CR]Screen refresh : 60.00 Hz[CR]Palette colors : 2048[CR]Players : 2[CR]Control : 8-way joystick[CR]Buttons : 4[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]The title of this game translates from Japanese as 'Overpowering Blood Temple Family'.[CR]Known outside Japan as "Power Instinct".[CR][B]Game Series[/B][CR]1. Gouketsuji Ichizoku (1993)[CR]2. Gouketsuji Ichizoku 2 (1994)[CR]3. Gouketsuji Ichizoku Saikyou Densetsu (1995)[CR]4. Gouketsuji Ichizoku 3 - Groove on Fight (1997)[CR]5. Shin Gouketsuji Ichizoku Tokon - Matrimelee (2003)[CR]6. Shin Gouketsuji Ichizoku - Bonnou Kaihou (2006, Sony PlayStation 2)[CR]7. Gouketsuji Ichizoku Senzo Kuyou (2009)[CR][B]Staff[/B][CR]Producer : Fuuuu[CR]Sub producer : Chuuko[CR]Programmers : Mako MK2, 680*0 Freak Yan[CR]Sound : Dencyu[CR]Front designers : Pa Pi Pu Pe, Masada-M, Super K!, Yie-Yah!, Ohryu-S[CR]Back designers : [Chikuwa] Henacyoko, Moto.I, Range, Asaki[CR]Songs : Tatanka Chorus (Tatanka No Uta), Japanese Cheering Party (Otoko No Karatemichi), Ainote Sisters (A Yoisyo De Ikou), Kurokos (Etc.)[CR]

game.name: Prehistoric Isle 2
game.plot: Prehistoric Isle 2 (c) 1999 Yumekobo.[CR]A side-scrolling shooter featuring helicopters and a great sequel to the previous game, filled with great details and good pre-rendered graphics combined with good sound effects.[CR]The plot takes us this time in the future where they have been a series of attacks in some parts of the world, leaving destruction in its wake, all this is caused once again by a invasion of legions of dinosaurs, to control this disastrous tragedy, we resort to the army, who sends two of his best helicopter armed with high-tech weapons, with which it hopes to eradicate the prehistoric menace.[CR]The players controls one of two types of helicopters, main difference is in the type of weaponry, both are re-powered by a series of power-ups which is obtained by eliminating the enemies, the Blue One has a wide and straight ahead shot and the bomb is a huge powerfull wave cannon and the Green One fires a spread shot and the bomb fires a multitude of grenades that eliminates effectively the enemies in front. There are to rescue and defend several civilians survivors of all the Jurassic army to earn points and power-ups to face the enemy boss of end phase and go the next level.[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID : 0255[CR]Main CPU : Motorola 68000 (@ 12 Mhz)[CR]Sound CPU : Zilog Z80 (@ 4 Mhz)[CR]Sound Chips : Yamaha YM2610 (@ 8 Mhz)[CR]Screen orientation : Horizontal[CR]Video resolution : 320 x 224 pixels[CR]Screen refresh : 59.19 Hz[CR]Palette colors : 4096[CR]Players : 2[CR]Control : 8-way joystick[CR]Buttons : 2[CR]=> [A] Shoot, [B] Bomber[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]Prehistoric Isle 2 was released in September 1999.[CR]This game is known in Japan as "Prehistoric Isle 2 - Genshi Tou".[CR]This game runs on the Neo-Geo MVS but was not released on the Neo-Geo AES home console.[CR][B]Tips and Tricks[/B][CR]* Challenge star : Successfully complete a stage without losing any lives.[CR]* Bonus Time : Build your weapon to maximum level, then select the same color again. Kill your enemies while in bonus time to increase the score multiplier up to x16.[CR]* Extra Bonus score: Near the end of stage, always are a TOUCH ME helicopter to rescue the civilians you pick un in the stage (not in stage 3 and 6). Instead of droping them there, avoid that helicopter and carry them to the end of the stage and beat the boss, obviously without dying. For every rescued civilian, you will get a 1x multiplier, so you can multiply the bonus by 5 if rescue all the civilians.[CR][B]Game Series[/B][CR]1. Prehistoric Isle in 1930 (1989)[CR]2. Prehistoric Isle 2 (1999)[CR][B]Staff[/B][CR]Executive producers : S. Takaoka, Tanaka[CR]Producer(rq) : James. W[CR]Planner : Barso[CR]Direction helpers : Satoshi ito, H. Miyagami, J. Seki[CR]Main programmer : Yuki[CR]Programmers : Y. Takasaki, Buttaku99, Masumura[CR]Tool programmer : Hiroaki Torii[CR]Chief designers : Y. Yonezawa, T. Nagakubo[CR]Designers : Masato Miyoshi, Michitaka Ishida, Yuko Hara, T.Hirokawa, Matsumoto Kiyoshi, Sho Tabira, kyo Yamanaka[CR]Design helpers : S. Katou, K. Mikamoto, R. Nagashima, H. Nobe, H. Ochiai, M. Shibata[CR]Sound designer & music composer : Masahiko Hataya[CR]

game.name: Pulstar
game.plot: Pulstar (c) 08/1995 Aicom.[CR]An accomplished and graphically superb sideways scrolling shoot-em-up that borrows many of its visual and gameplay elements from all three games in Irem's legendary "R*Type" series; including the Beam weapon and R-type's infamous pod attachment. Unlike "R*Type", however, Pulstar's pod cannot be detached from the front of the ship and merely acts as a shield to protect the player's ship.[CR]Pulstar consists of eight challenging levels, with the player able to start the game on any one of the first four.[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID : 0089[CR]Main CPU : Motorola 68000 (@ 12 Mhz)[CR]Sound CPU : Zilog Z80 (@ 4 Mhz)[CR]Sound Chips : Yamaha YM2610 (@ 8 Mhz)[CR]Screen orientation : Horizontal[CR]Video resolution : 320 x 224 pixels[CR]Screen refresh : 59.19 Hz[CR]Palette colors : 4096[CR]Players : 2[CR]Control : 8-way joystick[CR]Buttons : 2[CR]=> [A] Attack/Charge attack, [B] Restart the move[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]Pulstar was one of the first games on the NEO-GEO to use state-of-the-art SGI rendered graphics like those found in Nintendo Super Famicom's "Donkey Kong Country".[CR]The pre-production name of this game was 'Reaction'.[CR]Tracy Miller holds the official record for this game with 68,350 points.[CR]Pony Canyon / Scitron released a limited-edition soundtrack album for this game (Pulstar - PCCB-00192) on 21/10/1995.[CR][B]Staff[/B][CR]Staff : Nenko, M. Yoshida, T. Nagakubo, Naomi, Daikiti, K. Katoku, K. Urahama, K. Okabe, Toshio. I, Yamadasan, Shion, F. Ryuze[CR]Music composed by : Harumi Fujita, Yasuaki Fujita[CR][B]Game Ports[/B][CR]* Consoles :[CR]SNK Neo-Geo CD (1995)[CR]

game.name: Puzzle De Pon!
game.plot: Puzzle de Pon! (c) 1995 Taito.[CR]Drop the target plate before time runs out to clear each stage. To finish game, clear 39 different stages...[CR]Level 03 : GET Aries[CR]Level 06 : GET Taurus[CR]Level 09 : GET Gemini[CR]Level 12 : GET Cancer[CR]Level 15 : GET Leo[CR]Level 18 : GET Virgo[CR]Level 21 : GET Libra[CR]Level 24 : GET Scorpio[CR]Level 27 : GET Sagittarius[CR]Level 30 : GET Capricorn[CR]Level 33 : GET Aquarius[CR]Level 36 : GET Pisces[CR]Level 39 : Sun[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID : 0202[CR]Main CPU : Motorola 68000 (@ 12 Mhz)[CR]Sound CPU : Zilog Z80 (@ 4 Mhz)[CR]Sound Chips : Yamaha YM2610 (@ 8 Mhz)[CR]Screen orientation : Horizontal[CR]Video resolution : 320 x 224 pixels[CR]Screen refresh : 59.19 Hz[CR]Palette colors : 4096[CR]Players : 2[CR]Control : 8-way joystick[CR]Buttons : 1[CR]=> [A] Ball firing[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]Released in November 1995.[CR]Licensed to Visco.[CR]This game runs on the Neo-Geo MVS and was not released on the Neo-Geo AES home console.[CR]Ron Corcoran holds the official records for this game with 2,960,001 points (factory setting) on 12/20/1998.[CR][B]Game Series[/B][CR]1. game.name: Quiz King of Fighters (SAM-080 ~ SAH-080)
game.plot: Quiz King of Fighters (c) 1995 Saurus.[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID : 0080[CR]Main CPU : Motorola 68000 (@ 12 Mhz)[CR]Sound CPU : Zilog Z80 (@ 4 Mhz)[CR]Sound Chips : Yamaha YM2610 (@ 8 Mhz)[CR]Screen orientation : Horizontal[CR]Video resolution : 320 x 224 pixels[CR]Screen refresh : 59.19 Hz[CR]Palette colors : 4096[CR]Players : 2[CR]Control : 8-way joystick[CR]Buttons : 4[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]Released in February 1995.[CR]Based on the Neo-Geo fighting game series. The six playable characters are split two each from SNK's three fighting franchises (at the time). They are :[CR]"Art of Fighting" : Ryo Sakazaki and Robert Garcia[CR]"Fatal Fury - King of Fighters" : Terry Bogard and Mai Shiranui[CR]"Samurai Shodown" : Haohmaru and Nakoruru[CR]Of these six, Mai is the only one not to appear in the first game of their respective series (Mai debuted in "Fatal Fury 2"). Other characters from these three series appear as the people asking the questions or otherwise standing in the way. The exception is Yuri Sakazaki, of course, as the entire premise of this game is the six of them having to save her.[CR]A Korean version, made by Viccom, was released in 1996 on the Korean market.[CR][B]Staff[/B][CR]Producer : Nobuyuki Tanaka[CR]Planner : K. Ishimotti[CR]Programmers : Yuki, Donpa!, Koji, Jo., Mink.M[CR]Designers : Miyoshi Masato, 12341234, Kohtaroh Papa, SK, Miyoshi Sachiko, K. Tsugita, Kiyoshi Matsueda, Tawake Suzume, Miwako Kojima, Kaori Ito, Kurara Kiri, Y. Hara, Yuri Tachikawa, Azuma[CR]Sound : Sin Chan, Kaz Oshikiri, H.N., Hiro Takezo[CR][B]Game Ports[/B][CR]* Consoles :[CR]SNK Neo-Geo CD (1995)[CR]

game.name: Ragnagard / Shin-Oh-Ken
game.plot: Shin-Oh-Ken (c) 1996 Saurus.[CR]Pre-rendered pixelation puts somewhat of a damper on this Japanese fantasy fighter. Eight selectable characters and three end bosses.[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID : NGM-0218[CR]Players : 2[CR]Control : 8-way joystick[CR]Buttons : 4[CR]=> [A] Light Punch, [B] Light Kick, [C] Strong Punch, [D] Strong Kick[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]Shin-Oh-Ken was released in May 1996 in Japan.[CR]The title of the game translates from Japanese as 'True King Fist'.[CR]This game is known outside Japan as Ragnagard.[CR][B]Tips and Tricks[/B][CR]* Play As Behemoth : In character select screen, highlight Syuten-Dozi and press B, C, B, C, B(x2), C, then press A or D to select.[CR]* Play As Eelis : In character select screen, highlight Benten and press C(x2), B(x2), C, B, C, then press A or D to select.[CR]* Play As Lucifer : In character select screen, highlight Susano and press B, C(x3), B(x3), C, then press A or D to select.[CR][B]Staff[/B][CR]Developed by System Vision.[CR]Game Designer : Hiroaki Fujimoto[CR]Character Designer : Hiroaki Fujimoto[CR]World Designers : Hiroaki Fujimoto, Motohiro Toshiro[CR]Graphics : Hiroaki Fujimoto, Motohiro Toshiro, Koyama, Ryoumi Momota, Kyoosuke Motoya, Yasunori Hayashi[CR]Animation : Kyoosuke Motoya, Hiroaki Fujimoto, Koyama[CR]Fonts : Ryoumi Momota, M. Kihara, Zizi[CR]Programmers : Zakky , Yas, Hideki Suzuki[CR]Technical Adviser : Masaaki Yuuki[CR]Music : Hideki Suzuki[CR]Sound : Hideki Suzuki[CR]Voices : Sawatari Mutuki, Haruki, Sayu Mitou, Ishikawa, Hiroaki Fujimoto, Kyoosuke Motoya[CR]Tuning : Hiroaki Fujimoto, Masaaki Nagahora, Yuusuke Kunitomo[CR]Sales Promoters : Osamu Nagano, Kimihiko Kobayashi, Miwa Izumi, Tomoo Yoda[CR]Art Director : Koutarou Noumura[CR]Director : Ryoumi Momota[CR]Producers : Takahiro Shima, Yasushi Okahara[CR]Executive Producer : Nobuyuki Tanaka[CR][B]Game Ports[/B][CR]* Consoles :[CR]SNK Neo-Geo [JP] (July 26, 1996) [Model NGH-218][CR]SNK Neo-Geo [US] (July 26, 1996) [Model NGH-218][CR]SNK Neo-Geo CD [JP] (August 23, 1996) [Model NGCD-218][CR]Sega Saturn [JP] (April 4, 1997, "Shin-Oh-Ken [Model T-3113G]")[CR]Nintendo Wii [Virtual Console] [JP] (October 18, 2011)[CR]

game.title_clean: Real Bout Fatal Fury / Real Bout Garou Densetsu
game.plot: Real Bout Garou Densetsu (c) 1995 SNK.[CR]16 characters, some old and some new, breathe new life into the Fatal Fury series.[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID: NGM-095[CR]Players: 2[CR]Control: 8-way joystick[CR]Buttons: 4[CR]=> [A] Punch [B] Kick [C] Power Attack [D] Move Between Planes[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]Real Bout Garou Densetsu was released on December 21, 1995 in Japan.[CR]The title of the game translates from Japanese as 'Real Bout Hungry Wolf Legend'.[CR]This game is known outside Japan as 'Real Bout Fatal Fury'.[CR]Things that changed in this particular game :[CR]* The game uses a different 4 button setup this time around (punch, kick, power attack & plane switch) This was done to make the plane change mechanics easier to master.[CR]* Chain combos are easier to pull this time around as well.[CR]* This is one of the very few 2-D fighters to feature ring outs![CR]* Newcomers in the game are : Kim Kaphwan, Duck King & Billy Kane.[CR]Pony Canyon released a limited-edition soundtrack album for this game (Real Bout Garou Densetsu - PCCB-00203) on 07/02/1996.[CR][B]Tips and Tricks[/B][CR]An additional cut-scene can be seen by beating the game with either Terry or Andy Bogard.[CR][B]Game Series[/B][CR]1. Garou Densetsu - Shukumei no Tatakai [Model NGM-033] (1991, MVS)[CR]2. Garou Densetsu 2 - Arata-Naru Tatakai [Model NGM-047] (1992, MVS)[CR]3. Garou Densetsu Special [Model NGM-058] (1993, MVS)[CR]4. Garou Densetsu 3 - Harukanaru Tatakai [Model NGM-069] (1995, MVS)[CR]5. Real Bout Garou Densetsu [Model NGM-095] (1995, MVS)[CR]6. Real Bout Garou Densetsu Special [Model NGM-223] (1997, MVS)[CR]7. Real Bout Garou Densetsu 2 - The Newcomers [Model NGM-240] (199, MVS8)[CR]8. Fatal Fury Wild Ambition (1999, ARC)[CR]9. Garou - Mark of the Wolves [Model NGM-253] (1999, MVS)[CR]10. Fatal Fury First Contact [Model NEOP00111] (1999, NGPC)[CR][B]Staff[/B][CR]Big boss : Eikichi Kawasaki[CR]Producers : Takashi Nishiyama, H. Matsumoto, S. Itoh[CR]Planners : Tsuka-Michi, T. Yariyama, OH! Saba Meron[CR]Obj. designers : Higashi Pon, Mika.Poh, Fuku Fuku, Astro 1, Suke Chichi, Takehiro Isaji, Tsuzaki.A, Kamae 34, S. Tenuking, Yure Chichi, Soe Soe, G. Ishidaman[CR]Back. designers : Mic.Senbey, Midorin, Tomo, Ema Sue, Banamen, R. Nariai, Umechan[CR]Demo designers : Sezabon, Enokichi, Ega Nataku, Jida-Q, Maki-Torowa, Muramama, Sho-Chan[CR]effects : March Kaji, Kaoruru, Itokatsu, Tashiboo[CR]Programmers : Tony Oki (Tony-MF-Oki), Bo-Ffffffffng[CR]Sound : Toshio Shimizm (as Shimizm), SHA-V[CR]Special advisers : Stg-Oyaji 145H, Masahiko. Sawa[CR]* Voice Actors :[CR]Terry Bogard : Satoshi Hashimoto[CR]Andy Bogard : Keiichi Nanba[CR]Joe Higashi : Nobuyuki Hiyama[CR]Mai Shiranui : Akoya Sogi[CR]Sokaku Mochizuki : Koji Ishii[CR]Bob Wilson : Toshiyuki Morikawa[CR]Blue Mary : Harumi Ikoma[CR]Franco Bash : B. Love[CR]Geese Howard : Kong Kuwata[CR]Hon-Fu : Toshiyuki Morikawa[CR]Ryuji Yamazaki : Koji Ishii[CR]Kim Kaphwan : Satoshi Hashimoto[CR]Jin Chonshu : Kappei Yamaguchi[CR]Jin Chonrei : Kappei Yamaguchi[CR]Billy Kane : Atsushi Yamanishi[CR]Duck King : Kong Kuwata[CR][B]Game Ports[/B][CR]* Consoles :[CR]SNK Neo-Geo [JP] (Jan. 26, 1996; "Real Bout Garou Densetsu [Model NGH-095]")[CR]SNK Neo-Geo CD [JP] (Feb. 23, 1996; "Real Bout Garou Densetsu [Model NGCD-095]")[CR]Sega Saturn [JP] (Sep. 20, 1996; "Real Bout Garou Densetsu [Model T-3105G]")[CR]Sony PlayStation [JP] (Jan. 10, 1997; "Real Bout Garou Densetsu [Model SLPS-00640]")[CR]Sony PlayStation [JP] (July 23, 1998; "Real Bout Garou Densetsu [The Best] [Model SLPM-86108]")[CR]Sega Saturn [JP] (Aug. 06, 1998; "Real Bout Garou Densetsu Best Collection [Model T-3124G]")[CR]Sony PlayStation 2 [JP] (Feb. 22, 2007; "Garou Densetsu Battle Archives 2 [NeoGeo Online Collection Vol.6] [Model SLPS-25698]")[CR]Sony PlayStation 2 [JP] (May 29, 2008; "Garou Densetsu Battle Archives 2 [NeoGeo Online Collection The Best] [Model SLPS-25864]")[CR]

game.plot: Real Bout Garou Densetsu 2 - The Newcomers (c) 1998 SNK Corp.[CR]23 of the finest South Town fighters in the 7th installment of this SNK game.[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID : NGM-240[CR]Players : 2[CR]Control : 8-way joystick[CR]Buttons : 4[CR]=> [A] Punch [B] Kick [C] Power Attack [D] Move Between Planes[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]This game was shown at the 1998 AOU Amusement Expo show, in Japan. it was then released in March 1998.[CR]The title of the game translates from Japanese as 'Real Bout Hungry Wolf Legend 2'.[CR]This game is known outside Japan as 'Real Bout Fatal Fury 2 - The Newcomers'.[CR]Things that changed in this particular game :[CR]* The game now features 'single plane' stages (like the ones seen in "Fatal Fury - King of Fighters", "Fatal Fury 2" & "Fatal Fury Special") in which you can slam enemies against background objects![CR]* The breakable objects system seen in Real Bout Special is gone. Also the "evil character" versions of some characters are gone as well.[CR]* Newcomers in this game are : Li Xiangfei, Rick Strowd & Alfred.[CR]A serious bug : Using a USA bios ROM if you insert a coin on the 'winners don't use drugs' screen on a single slot the games will use the neogeo bios s1 tile-set rather than the game tiles, this causes most of the graphics to be hidden and the games to be unplayable, it will also end up using the main-board z80 bios so sound will be broken, the games should fix themselves if you let them run another attract loop after game-over, on a multi-slot the games will reset. This is one of the first 4 'gigapower' games, the bug was fixed after that.[CR]Pony Canyon / Scitron released a limited-edition soundtrack album for this game (Real Bout Garou Densetsu 2 The Newcomers / PCCB-00310) on April 17, 1998.[CR][B]Tips and Tricks[/B][CR]* Fight against Alfred : Begin game play in single player mode, finish off the first 10 fights with no losses, score over 750000 by the time the 10th fight is won, land 5 P.POWER moves or 7 S.POWER moves. You will fight Alfred in a desert type stage.[CR]* You may scope out each character's best records by tapping A button to move forward or B button to move back at the score ranking screen :).[CR][B]Game Series[/B][CR]1. Garou Densetsu - Shukumei no Tatakai [Model NGM-033] (1991, MVS)[CR]2. Garou Densetsu 2 - Arata-Naru Tatakai [Model NGM-047] (1992, MVS)[CR]3. Garou Densetsu Special [Model NGM-058] (1993, MVS)[CR]4. Garou Densetsu 3 - Harukanaru Tatakai [Model NGM-069] (1995, MVS)[CR]5. Real Bout Garou Densetsu [Model NGM-095] (1995, MVS)[CR]6. Real Bout Garou Densetsu Special [Model NGM-223] (1997, MVS)[CR]7. Real Bout Garou Densetsu 2 - The Newcomers [Model NGM-240] (199, MVS8)[CR]8. Fatal Fury Wild Ambition (1999, ARC)[CR]9. Garou - Mark of the Wolves [Model NGM-253] (1999, MVS)[CR]10. Fatal Fury First Contact [Model NEOP00111] (1999, NGPC)[CR][B]Staff[/B][CR]Executive Producer : Takashi Nishiyama[CR]Producer : Hiroshi Matsumoto[CR]Co-Producer : S. Itoh[CR]Planners : Tsukamichi (Tsuka Michi+2), Takahisa Yariyama, Maja OH! Mori, Oda-Q, Emi-Gon[CR]Design Front : Soe Soe (Soe-Soe), Honekawa Now-45Kg, Nobuyuki Kuroki, Ito-Taku, Ogura Eiichi, Nal, Y. Ashizawa, G. Ishidaman (G. Ishida Man DX), Yas. Kamae, Mimika, Tashiboo, Tokumasa, Yuuichi Uchide, CG, Team CG. Works[CR]Back Designers : Mic Senbei, Murayama, Tomo, Daisuke, Risa, Sakura3, Midorin, Hidenao. J, Shimiji, Eiko[CR]Demo Designers : Kaoruru, Uruuru, Kumiko. M[CR]Sound : Sha-V, Miwa, Marino, Captain Beroou[CR]Programmers : Boffffffng (as Bof), Kura, Air as G. Rok. (Konbu)[CR]Supervisors : Kiyoshi Asai, SG Melon[CR]Voice Actors : Satoshi Hashimoto, Nobuyuki Hiyama, Toshiyuki Morikawa, Kappei Yamaguchi, Atsushi Yamanishi, Hiroyuki Arita, Keiichi Nanba, Akoya Sogi, Kong Kuwata, Koji Ishii, Harumi Ikoma, B. J. Love, Tanny Yamaguchi, Mami Kingetsu, Hiro Yuuki, Mi Yeon Jeong, Ji Hwan Ahn[CR]Special Thanks : Sekotch, Anne, Uni & Buri (XO), Bashi, Shochan, Asami Don, Oh!Butch[CR][B]Game Ports[/B][CR]* Consoles :[CR]SNK Neo-Geo [JP] (Apr. 29, 1998; "Real Bout Garou Densetsu 2 [Model NGH-240]")[CR]SNK Neo-Geo CD [JP] (July 23, 1998; "Real Bout Garou Densetsu 2 [Model NGCD-240]")[CR]Sony PlayStation 2 [JP] (Feb. 22, 2007; "Garou Densetsu Battle Archives 2 [NeoGeo Online Collection Vol.6] [Model SLPS-25698]")[CR]Sony PlayStation 2 [JP] (May 29, 2008; "Garou Densetsu Battle Archives 2 [NeoGeo Online Collection The Best] [Model SLPS-25864]")[CR]Nintendo Wii [EU] [Virtual Console] (October 04, 2012)[CR]

game.name: Real Bout Fatal Fury Special / Real Bout Garou Densetsu Special
game.description: Real Bout Fatal Fury Special / Real Bout Garou Densetsu Special
game.title_clean: Real Bout Fatal Fury Special / Real Bout Garou Densetsu Special
game.plot: Real Bout Garou Densetsu Special (c) 1997 SNK Corp.[CR]'Hey, how's it goin', dude?' More old Fatal favorites return to the bout and bring the total of selectable fighters to 19.[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID : NGM-223[CR]Players : 2[CR]Control : 8-way joystick[CR]Buttons : 4[CR]=> [A] Punch [B] Kick [C] Power Attack [D] Move Between Planes[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]Even if the copyright year is 1996, this game was released to the public in January 1997.[CR]The title translates from Japanese as 'Real Bout Hungry Wolf Legend Special'[CR]This game is known outside Japan as 'Real Bout Fatal Fury Special'.[CR]Things that changed in this particular game :[CR]* The game modifies the plane switching system a bit.[CR]* Ring out system is modified into the instant dizzy system (By breaking background objects!).[CR]* Newcomers in the game are Cheng Sinzan, Tung Fu Rue, Laurence Blood & Wolfgang Krauser. 'Evil' versions of some characters are available as well.[CR]Terry's theme in this game is a remixed version of Terry's familiar "Fatal Fury 2" music (Kurikinton).[CR]Soundtrack releases :[CR]February 5, 1997 ; Real Bout Garou Densetsu Special [CD] [PCCB-00240] - Pony Canyon[CR][B]Updates[/B][CR]MVS (Arcade) vs. AES (Neo-Geo) differences :[CR]On the AES (Neo-Geo) Geese is a playable character by imputing a code. On the MVS (Arcade) version he was removed as a playable character for being too strong.[CR][B]Tips and Tricks[/B][CR]* Play as Shadow/EX Fighter : Shadow/EX fighter is an evil version of the selected character with a different move-list set as well as a different ending than his/her original counterpart. This code only works with the following characters : Andy Bogard, Billy Kane, Blue Mary, Tung Fu Rue.[CR]1) At the character selection screen, highlight the character of your choice, hold Start and press B(x2), C(x2).[CR]2) While continuing to hold Start, hold B, pause one second and hold C.[CR]3) While continuing to hold Start+B+C, press A or D to select the Shadow version of the character.[CR]4) Pressing A or D will select a different color.[CR]* Fight against Geese Howard : Begin game play in single player mode, win all rounds, do not score less than a 'B' rank in any battle and get more than 750,000 points befire fighting Wolfgang Krauser. You will fight Geese Howard in a special 'Nightmare' match.[CR]* You can see different sets of funny outtakes during the credits if you consecutively beat the game 5 or 6 times before they start to repeat themselves.[CR][B]Game Series[/B][CR]1. Garou Densetsu - Shukumei no Tatakai [Model NGM-033] (1991, MVS)[CR]2. Garou Densetsu 2 - Arata-Naru Tatakai [Model NGM-047] (1992, MVS)[CR]3. Garou Densetsu Special [Model NGM-058] (1993, MVS)[CR]4. Garou Densetsu 3 - Harukanaru Tatakai [Model NGM-069] (1995, MVS)[CR]5. Real Bout Garou Densetsu [Model NGM-095] (1995, MVS)[CR]6. Real Bout Garou Densetsu Special [Model NGM-223] (1997, MVS)[CR]7. Real Bout Garou Densetsu 2 - The Newcomers [Model NGM-240] (199, MVS8)[CR]8. Fatal Fury Wild Ambition (1999, ARC)[CR]9. Garou - Mark of the Wolves [Model NGM-253] (1999, MVS)[CR]10. Fatal Fury First Contact [Model NEOP00111] (1999, NGPC)[CR][B]Staff[/B][CR]Producers : Takashi Nishiyama, Hiroshi Matsumoto, S. Itoh[CR]Planners : Takahisa Yariyama, Higashi Pon, Oh! Majaharu, Tsukamichi (Tsuka_Michi)[CR]Obj Designers : Rio, Soe Soe (Soe. Soe. 96), Oda_Bash, N. Kuroki, Lionheart35, Mizu. Mizu, G. Ishidaman (Ishidamanace), Ossya!, Takehiro Isaji, Y. Ashizawa, Kaoruru, Nishikawa, Mika R. Winner Ero_Beer_Toku[CR]Back Designers : Mic Senbey, Midorin, Tomo, Nari, Locate, Taka_Oh!![CR]Demo Designers : Sezabon, N. Kuroki, Ogura_A_1[CR]Effects : Tashiboo, Akirya[CR]Sound : Tate Norio, Konny, Toshio Shimizm (Shimizm), Ackey, Brother Hige, Mariko, Macky, Kyochan (Kyo_Chan), Miwa, Imo[CR]Programmers : Bo_ffffffffng (as Bof), Naoyan Apchiba[CR]Supervisors : Stg_Oyaji 145H, Mim_104 Melon, R. Tuneoka[CR]* Voice Actors :[CR]Terry Bogard, Kim Kaphwan : Satoshi Hashimoto[CR]Joe Higashi : Nobuyuki Hiyama[CR]Bob Wilson, Hon Fu : Toshiyuki Morikawa[CR]Jin Chonshu & Chonrei : Kappei Yamaguchi[CR]Billy Kane : Atsushi Yamanishi[CR]Laurence Blood : Hiroyuki Arita[CR]Tung Fu Rue, Cheng Sinzan : Shigefumi Nakai[CR]Andy Bogard : Keiichi Nanba[CR]Mai Shiranui : Akoya Sogi[CR]Duck King, Geese Howard : Kong Kuwata[CR]Sokaku Mochizuki, Ryuji Yamazaki : Koji Ishii[CR]Blue Mary : Harumi Ikoma[CR]Franco Bash, Wolfgang Krauser, Announcer (English) : B. J. Love[CR]Special Thanks : Kura, MF_Yama. Remix, Shochan, Asami Don[CR][B]Game Ports[/B][CR]* Consoles :[CR]SNK Neo-Geo [JP] (Feb. 05, 1997; "Real Bout Garou Densetsu Special [Model NGH-223]")[CR]SNK Neo-Geo CD [JP] (Mar. 30, 1997; "Real Bout Garou Densetsu Special [Model NGCD-223]")[CR]Sega Saturn [JP] (Dec. 25, 1997; "Real Bout Garou Densetsu Special [Model T-3117G]")[CR]Sega Saturn [JP] (Dec. 25, 1997; "Real Bout Garou Densetsu Special [Model T-3119G]")[CR]Nintendo Game Boy [JP] (Mar. 27, 1998; "Nettou Real Bout Garou Densetsu Special [Model DMG-ARBJ-JPN]")[CR]Sega Saturn [JP] (Aug 06, 1998; "Real Bout Garou Densetsu Best Collection [Model T-3124G]")[CR]Sony PlayStation 2 [JP] (Feb. 22, 2007; "Garou Densetsu Battle Archives 2 [NeoGeo Online Collection Vol.6] [Model SLPS-25698]")[CR]Sony PlayStation 2 [JP] (May 29, 2008; "Garou Densetsu Battle Archives 2 [NeoGeo Online Collection The Best] [Model SLPS-25864]")[CR]* Computers :[CR]PC (2001)[CR]

game.name: Riding Hero (NGM-006 ~ NGH-006)
game.plot: Riding Hero (c) 1990 SNK.[CR]A Hot Battle Awaits You On The Way To The W.G.P Racing Title! After getting the 'International A License', a young racer battles his way to the Suzuka 8 Hour Race. Featuring 3 ways to play! W.G.P mode, RPG mode or Multi Play mode. GO FOR THE GLORY![CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID: NGM-006[CR]Players: 2[CR]Control: 8-way joystick[CR]Buttons: 3[CR]=> [A] Accelerator, [B] Brake, [C] Turbo[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]Released in July 1990.[CR]Riding Hero is the first Neo-Geo game to feature the 'Multi Play Function', this lets you 'link' cabinets together so players can race each other side by side.[CR][B]Staff[/B][CR]Producer : Eikichi Kawasaki[CR]Director : Hiroshi Matsumoto[CR]Programmer : H. Deep. T[CR]Music : Synthesize Yamada[CR]Sound Effects : Jojoha Kitapy (Jojoha Kitamura)[CR]Character Designers : Kouichi Sakita, Takurin. K, Kimie. M, Masayo. S[CR]Special Thanks: Kura, Masapee. K, Pao-Pao, Mr. Noric, Takayuki. M, Cock-A-Doodle-Doo[CR][B]Game Ports[/B][CR]* Consoles :[CR]SNK Neo-Geo [JP] (July 1, 1991; "Riding Hero [Model NGH-006]")[CR]SNK Neo-Geo [US] (July 1, 1991; "Riding Hero [Model NGH-006]")[CR]SNK Neo-Geo CD [JP] (May 26, 1995; "Riding Hero [Model NGCD-006]")[CR]SNK Neo-Geo CD [US] (May 26, 1995; "Riding Hero [Model NGCD-006E]")[CR]

game.name: Robo Army
game.plot: Robo Army (c) 1991 SNK [Shin Nihon Kikaku]. [CR]Two robotic soldiers attempt to stop the robots and their master from enslaving the human race.[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID : NGM-032[CR]Players : 2[CR]Control : 8-Way Joystick[CR]Buttons : 3[CR]=> [A] Punch, [B] Jump, [C] Kick/Get Super-Powers with Cyber-Ball[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]Robo Army was released on October 30, 1991 in Japan.[CR]Player 2's character appears as a striker character in "The King of Fighters 2000" as Rocky.[CR][B]Staff[/B][CR]Excutive Producer : Eikichi Kawasaki[CR]Programmers : Oh!Butch, Arcbbcov, Shochan, Ma2, Kawaii[CR]Sound : Yamapy-1, Konny[CR]Production Designer : Kouichi Sakita[CR]Designers : Takeshi Kimura, Take-P, Shimachan, UG Wada, Pinkey[CR]Associate Producer : Hiroshi Matsumoto (Finish Hiroshi)[CR]Planners : Akira Goto, Yarie[CR][B]Game Ports[/B][CR]* Consoles :[CR]SNK Neo-Geo [JP] (December 20, 1991; "Robo Army [Model NGH-032]")[CR]SNK Neo-Geo [US] (December 20, 1991; "Robo Army [Model NGH-032]")[CR]SNK Neo-Geo CD [JP] (April 21, 1995; "Robo Army [Model NGCD-032]")[CR]SNK Neo-Geo CD [US] (April 21, 1995; "Robo Army [Model NGCD-032E]")[CR]

game.name: Rage of the Dragons (NGM-2640?)
game.plot: Rage of the Dragons (c) 2002 Playmore Corp.[CR]Rage of the Dragons is an original fighting game with 14 selectable fighters plus Abubo (sub-boss, hidden character) and Johann (final boss).[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID: NGM-264[CR]Players: 2[CR]Control: 8-way Joystick[CR]Buttons: 4[CR]=> [A] Weak Punch, [B] Weak Kick, [C] Strong Punch, [D] Strong Kick[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]Released in June 2002, Rage of the Dragons is the first fighting game developed by Evoga Entertainment. This game is a collaboration between Evoga (Mexico), Brezza Soft (Japan) and Noise Factory (Japan).[CR]Evoga tried to make a new "Double Dragon" game and attempted to acquire the rights to "Double Dragon" from Technos Japan but they refused to sell. Without the proper rights to use the Double Dragon property, Evoga decided to do a game that pays homage to the Double Dragon series instead. For example, William 'Billy' Lewis, James 'Jimmy' Lewis and 'Abubo' are analogous to the characters Billy Lee, Jimmy Lee and Abobo from "Double Dragon". One funny thing about these Evoga characters is that they appear in Noise Factory's "Matrimeele", which is based on the Power Instinct series by Atlus.[CR]Pupa Salgueiro & Cassandra Murata are the only characters in the game that have two super moves instead of just one. These being the Ultimate Quexada (for Pupa) and a ground version of the White Wave (for Cassandra).[CR]Linda, the famous lady with the whip in the Double Dragon games makes an appearance as one of Abubo's girlfriends in his intro pose as well as in the second Abubo cutscene.[CR]Alice Carroll's name seems curiously inspired in the famous children's book "Alice in Wonderland" and by the name of its author Lewis Carroll. Odd...[CR]Jones features many funny references to Bruce Lee such as his outfit (Bruce Lee's famous outfit in the 'Game of Death' movie), a few of his moves & poses, and a suspicious quote in his ending! :)[CR]The stage of Radel and Annie is a night club called 'Noise Factory' just as one of the 3 companies which worked on the game.[CR]On the parking lot stage, there is a TV screen displaying credits for a movie. It contains Engrish text 'Special Sanks' instead of 'Special Thanks'.[CR]Noise Factory released a limited-edition soundtrack album for this game (Rage of the Dragons Original Arrange Album) on 13/09/2002.[CR][B]Tips and Tricks[/B][CR]* Play as Abubo : at the character select screen, press quickly Up(x4), Down(x3), Left(x2), Right. A little melody indicates that the cheat worked and Abubo should appear on center.[CR]* The game encourages the use of team up attacks. In fact, by finishing each opponent with a team up attack will get you some nice grades & a respectable score! (perfect lifebars with this tip will get you a handsome SSS grade every time!!!) :)[CR]* Jones' air version of his First Impact combo is broken against Alice since the last hit will always miss! Beware! :/[CR]* Johann, the last boss in the game cannot be dizzied since he lacks a dizzy animation, this can be seen by performing a team up attack on him. This makes this already cheap boss even harder to defeat! :/[CR]* After each battle, a rank is determined based on your fighting level. Here are the different levels and the bonus points awarded to the player if he reaches them :[CR]SSS : 100,000 points[CR]SS : 75,000 points[CR]S : 50,000 points[CR]A : 25,000 points[CR]B : 10,000 points[CR]C : 7,500 points[CR]D : 5,000 points[CR]E : 0 point[CR][B]Staff[/B][CR]Producer : Boss[CR]Directors : Angel Sword, Mamaro, Hidenari Mamoto[CR]Sub. Directors : Mr. Vo, Tetsu[CR]Planners : Mr. Vo, EDU[CR]Main Programmer : Hidenari Mamoto[CR]Sub. Programmers : Kazuaki Ezato, Hirosi Hisikawa[CR]Character Designers : Super Dotter K', Mr. Vo, Mamero, Dessy, Nankin, Bel Mont, Hikaru Suf, Shio Shio Shio, Rinkenedu, Edu, Shuhey Kawasaki, Jaga Danshaku[CR]Background Designers : Miyukichi, Kuramoyan, Reiko Nagasima (Reiko N), Fukkie, MR.Vo, Darb, Shin Ryu[CR]Illustration : Ooma Bunshichiro[CR]Sound Producer : Studio Aqua[CR]Testers : Bel Mont, Orochi, Shin Ryu, G. Miyazaki, Y. Takahasi, S. Adati, Y. Karu, Y. Sinihara[CR]Special Thanks : Y. Jinno, Keiko Ijuu, Muking, Tozani, Vic Dom Cas, Eri San, Moon Dragon, Zhila, Ryuushika, Rau, O-841, Kaiware[CR][B]Game Ports[/B][CR]* Consoles :[CR]SNK Neo-Geo [JP] (Sep. 20, 2002) "Rage of the Dragons [Model NGH-264]"[CR]SNK Neo-Geo [US] (Sep. 20, 2002) "Rage of the Dragons [Model NGH-264]"[CR]

game.name: Strikers 1945 Plus
game.plot: Strikers 1945 Plus (c) 1999 Psikyo.[CR]After inserting quarters and hitting the Start button, the player chooses one of 6 planes (plus 1 hidden plane) or can opt for a random choice.[CR]The available fighters are :[CR]* P-38 Lightning[CR]* Vought XF5U 'Flying Pancake'[CR]* Spitfire Mk. VI[CR]* Zero Type 52[CR]* Focke Wulf Ta 152[CR]* Fiat G.56[CR]* XP-55 Ascender (Hidden) [CR]The first 4 stages are in random order, while the last 4 are sequential. Players collect weapon powerups, bombs, and gold bars for points. Each plane has a unique 'supershot' which is charged by damaging enemies and fired by holding then releasing the fire button. Supershots can be stored, although the number varies from plane to plane. Using a Bomb results in a large friendly fighter swooping onto the screen and blocking shots while returning fire for a few seconds.[CR]After the player beats the final boss, the game starts again from the beginning, albeit at a much higher difficulty level. All level are similar to the ones in Strikers 1945 II. Only one of the 4 bosses that are randomly chosen and the 6th boss is changed.[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID : 0254[CR]Main CPU : Motorola 68000 (@ 12 Mhz)[CR]Sound CPU : Zilog Z80 (@ 4 Mhz)[CR]Sound Chips : Yamaha YM2610 (@ 8 Mhz)[CR]Screen orientation : Horizontal[CR]Video resolution : 320 x 224 pixels[CR]Screen refresh : 59.19 Hz[CR]Palette colors : 4096[CR]Players : 2[CR]Control : 8-way joystick[CR]Buttons : 2[CR]=> [A] Shot/Supershot, [B] Support attack[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]Released in December 1999.[CR]This is an updated version of "Strikers 1945 II" and is exclusive to the Neo-Geo. This is Psikyo's first and only game developed and released for the Neo-Geo MVS (but was not released on the Neo-Geo AES home console).[CR]The game forbids the initials 'SEX' or 'KKK' on the high score table. If you try, they get changed to 3 smileys.[CR][B]Tips and Tricks[/B][CR]* Play as Ascender : At the selection screen, highlight the '?' symbol and press Down+A+B.[CR]* Play as Ascender (Alternate) : Highlight the '?' symbol and press Up, Down, Up, Down, UP(x4), Down. Ascender should appear.[CR][B]Game Series[/B][CR]1. Strikers 1945 (1995)[CR]2. Strikers 1945 II (1997)[CR]3. Strikers 1945 Plus (1999)[CR]4. Strikers 1999 (1999)[CR][B]Staff[/B][CR]Composers : Masaki Izutani[CR]

game.name: Samurai Shodown V Special / Samurai Spirits Zero Special (NGM-2720)
game.description: Samurai Shodown V Special / Samurai Spirits Zero Special (NGM-2720)
game.title_clean: Samurai Shodown V Special / Samurai Spirits Zero Special
game.plot: Samurai Spirits Zero Special (c) 2004 SNK Playmore.[CR]An 'upgrade' of the Samurai Spirits Zero episode with its 24 fighters plus 4 more characters : Amakusa, Gaoh, Zankuro and Mizuki. It's probably the ultimate game released on MVS since SNK Playmore decided to develop its future games on AtomisWave.[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID : NGM-272[CR]Players : 2[CR]Control : 8-way Joystick[CR]Buttons : 4[CR]=> [A] Light attack, [B] Medium attack, [C] Kick/Break defence, [D] Lie down/Forward roll/Back roll/Small jump/Dodge[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]Samurai Spirits Zero Special was released in April 2004 in Japan.[CR]This game is known outside Japan as 'Samurai Shodown V Special'.[CR]The original version of the game contain some bugs and characters don't have fatalities. To correct that, SNK Playmore released corrected cartridges (without any problems) which can be recognized by a small NeoGeo sticker on the top right[CR]On the game box, SNK put the following message : 'A final Farewell. To all of our customers, who have purchased NeoGeo rom cartridges up till now, thank you very much. We offer our most heartfelt gratitude for your loyal patronage over these 14 full years and hope for your continued support for our games on the many other platforms we will provide products for in the future. NeoGeo fans rule!'.[CR]Some rumors says that SNK Playmore wanted to release an other upgrade of "Samurai Shodown V" on NeoGeo MVS called "Samurai Shodown V Special Final" including 2 new characters, some new stages and the correction of all the original game's bugs. A location test occurred in Tokyo in october 2004 but then SNK Playmore denied developing this game.[CR][B]Tips and Tricks[/B][CR]* I'm Not Afraid Of You! : think you are really good? Tap Start 3 times quickly to make your character drop his/her sword. Now show your opponents that the most fearsome weapons are the ones you were born with![CR]* The game has several last bosses: Amakusa, Zankuro, Gao and Muzuki. In order to reach the latter bosses, you need to perform a fatality on the former ones. If you don't, you'll instead get a bad ending.[CR][B]Game Series[/B][CR]1. Samurai Spirits [Model NGM-045] (1993)[CR]2. Shin Samurai Spirits - Haohmaru Jigoku Hen [Model NGM-063] (1994)[CR]3. Samurai Spirits - Zankurou Musouken [Model NGM-087] (1995)[CR]4. Samurai Spirits - Amakusa Kourin [Model NGM-222] (1996)[CR]5. Samurai Shodown 64 (1997)[CR]6. Samurai Shodown 64 - Warrior's Rage (1998)[CR]7. Kenkaku Ibunroku Yomigaerishi Soukou no Ha - Samurai Spirits Shinshou (1999, PSX)[CR]8. Samurai Spirits Zero [Model NGM-270] (2003)[CR]9. Samurai Spirits Zero Special [Model NGM-272] (2004)[CR]10. Samurai Spirits - Tenkaichi Kenkakuden (2005)[CR]11. game.name: Samurai Shodown / Samurai Spirits (NGM-045)
game.plot: Samurai Spirits (c) 1993 SNK.[CR]The game that put the Neo-Geo on the map! Superb weapons-based fighter featuring 12 characters, bonus rounds and one end boss.[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID : NGM-045[CR]Players : 2[CR]Control : 8-way joystick[CR]Buttons : 4[CR]=> With weapon : [A] Light attack, [B] Medium attack[CR]=> Without weapon : [A] Light punch, [B] Medium punch, [C] Light kick, [D] Medium kick[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]Samurai Spirits was released in July 1993 in Japan.[CR]The game is known outside Japan as 'Samurai Shodown'[CR]Samurai Spirits is the first game that introduced weapon fighting into the fighting game genre. The game used an upgraded version of the scaling graphics engine that was originally featured in "Art of Fighting".[CR]Samurai Spirits also started SNK's reputation for their unique style of Engrish, known as SNKgrish in their games.[CR]Unlike "Mortal Kombat", the usage of blood in this game is generally accepted, and the decision to replace blood with 'white blood' remains a sore point among fans of this series.[CR]Samurai Spirits is considered by some to portray Japanese culture and language effectively. Unlike most American versions of Japanese video games, the characters in this game (including the announcer) generally speak fluent Japanese with subtitles, and traditional Japanese music is often heard during gameplay. Samurai Shodown takes most of its characters from either historical sources or characters from the Ninja Scroll anime. In fact, a few designers that worked on Samurai Shodown also worked on the Ninja Scroll anime...[CR]Haohmaru is based on the legendary samurai Miyamoto Musashi (1584-1645), whose fighting philosophy heavily influenced that of the Haohmaru character.[CR]Ukyo Tachibana is Based on Sasaki Kojiro Genryu (1572-1612), Musashi's skilled rival.[CR]Jubei Yagyu is based on the historical Yagyu Jubei Mitsuyoshi (1606-1644), who was a sword instructor to the Tokugawa shogunate. The Yagyu clan was a famous clan of samurai.[CR]Hattori Hanzo Masashige (1541-1596) was the most famous of the Iga Ninja clan. He was a genius at leading night raids on forts and fiefs and became a feared assassin. Under his leadership, Iga Ninja became so notorious that Nobunaga felt it necessary to obliterate the Iga Ninja clan.[CR]Wan-Fu seems to be a combination of two famous Chinese warriors. The first is a famous Chinese swordsman who was a rebel during the Ch'ing Dynasty. His name was Wang Ts-bin Wu, but he became known as Da Dao Wang Wu ('Big Scimitar Wang Wu'). The second lead bases Wan Fu upon the ancient, almost legendary, founder of the Chou Dynasty, King Wu Wang.[CR]Kyoshiro Senryo is based on Nemuri Kyoshiro, a fictional character created by Shibata Tosaburo. 'Kyoshiro' translates to something like 'deranged fellow'. Tosaburo's Kyoshiro had nothing to do with kabuki theater as does Samurai Shodown Kyoshiro. Kyoshiro's weapon is called a naginata.[CR]Charlotte is based on a character in the manga 'The Rose of Versailles' by Riyoko Ikeda (1972).[CR]Gen-an Shiranui looks much like Mushizo, the hunchback demon of Ninja Scroll. Gen-an's weapon is modeled after the weapon wielded by Shijima, the shadow demon, from Ninja Scroll. Although they share a surname, Gen-an is not a relative of Mai Shiranui of the Fatal Fury/King of Fighters series.[CR]Amakusa Shiro Tokisada (1622-1638) led a Christian uprising against the Tokugawa shogunate in the Shimabara region of Japan.[CR]Nakoruru is a homage to Sailor Moon.[CR]A 'Kuroko' is a traditional Kabuki theater stagehand. They are traditionally dressed in black and took care of scenery and other behind-the-scenes needs during a Kabuki performance, just like modern theater stagehands. In the case of Samurai Shodown, Kuroko is the referee for each match in Samurai Shodown I and II. The black strip of fabric hanging over a Kuroko's face is to signify that they are not part of the Kabuki performance, just helping with the props. The red and white flags that Kuroko has are used in traditional martial arts matches, where each successful hit gets the corresponding fighter's flag raised.[CR]Mai Shiranui (of Fatal Fury) appears in Haohmaru's and Gen-An's endings.[CR]Pony Canyon / Scitron released a limited-edition soundtrack album for this game (Samurai Spirits - PCCB-00135) on 17/09/1993.[CR][B]Tips and Tricks[/B][CR]* Alternate Costume Colors : Highlight a fighter at the character selection screen and press D.[CR]* Sleeping Mamahaha : This is just hilarious! To see this while playing as Nakoruru simply stand still, after a 8 secs or so Mamahaha will land on Nakoruru's shoulder, start yawning and then it will fall asleep![CR]* Poppy's Puppies : To see a truly cool & funny secret pose with Galford, Get a PERFECT against an opponent while unarmed. You must finish the battle with anything except a throw though![CR]* Tam Tam's Broken Ending : If you use continues while beating the game with Tam Tam, you will miss a part of the whole ending (You can't see his real face). Beat the game with one credit in order to see his face.[CR]* Wan-fu's Sword Explosion Bug : While playing as Wan-fu trap an enemy against the edge of the screen then perform the Explosive Sword Drop with the B button (HCB + B) to throw the sword and land next to the opponent. Since most players as well as the CPU are likely to block the move, crouch and hit them with the C button (a short kick). This will make the move unblockable and causes tons of damage![CR]* Cut-proof Characters? : Sometimes a finishing slash will cut most opponents in half, however some characters (these being Kyoshiro & Amakusa) cannot be cut in half![CR][B]Game Series[/B][CR]1. Samurai Spirits [Model NGM-045] (1993)[CR]2. Shin Samurai Spirits - Haohmaru Jigoku Hen [Model NGM-063] (1994)[CR]3. Samurai Spirits - Zankurou Musouken [Model NGM-087] (1995)[CR]4. Samurai Spirits - Amakusa Kourin [Model NGM-222] (1996)[CR]5. Samurai Shodown 64 (1997)[CR]6. Samurai Shodown 64 - Warrior's Rage (1998)[CR]7. game.title_clean: Samurai Shodown II / Shin Samurai Spirits - Haohmaru Jigokuhen
game.plot: 真 SAMURAI SPIRITS 覇王丸地獄変 (c) 1994 SNK Corporation.[CR](Shin Samurai Spirits - Haohmaru Jigoku Hen)[CR]The second game in this wildly popular series features 15 weapon-wielding fighters clashing to earn the right to face the extremely difficult end boss.[CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the SNK "Neo-Geo MVS" hardware.[CR]Game ID : NGM-063[CR]Players : 2[CR]Control : 8-Way Joystick[CR]Buttons : 4[CR]=> [A] Light Attack with weapon, [B] Medium Attack with weapon, [C] Light Kick, [D] Medium Kick[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]Shin Samurai Spirits was released in October 1994.[CR]The title of the game translates from Japanese as 'True Samurai Spirits - Haohmaru's Incident In Hell'.[CR]This game is known outside Japan as 'Samurai Shodown II'.[CR]Kafuin Nicotine (Anglicized as 'Caffiene') is based somewhat on the Ninja Scroll character Dakuan who shares outfit and is armed with similar weapons. The 'papers' that Nicotine throws are called 'o-fuda', which are talismans inscribed with a prayer to endow them with certain powers. Japanese occultism and lore at work.[CR]Neinhalt Sieger's name translates from German as 'non-stop victory'.[CR]Genjuro Kibagami is a huge reference to a Japanese hanafuda deck. Hanafuda is a Japanese card game in which all cards represent a certain flower and time of the year. The hanafuda cards can be seen when Genjuro hits his opponent with special moves. Among the cards seen are wistaria, maple and peony. All cards shown are from an actual hanafuda deck.[CR]Ryuhaku Todo (of AOF) appears in Gen-An's ending.[CR]If you wait a long time, Hikyaku will throw food and/or bombs to the screen. Every so often, Kim Kaphwan (of Fatal Fury) will come out instead.[CR]Kuroko's moves are largely borrowed from other characters.[CR]Pony Canyon / Scitron released a limited-edition soundtrack album for this game (Shin Samurai Spirits - PCCB-00164) on 02/11/1994.[CR][B]Tips and Tricks[/B][CR]* Alternate Costumes Colors : Press D instead of A to choose your character.[CR][B]Game Series[/B][CR]1. Samurai Spirits [Model NGM-045] (1993)[CR]2. Shin Samurai Spirits - Haohmaru Jigoku Hen [Model NGM-063] (1994)[CR]3. Samurai Spirits - Zankurou Musouken [Model NGM-087] (1995)[CR]4. Samurai Spirits - Amakusa Kourin [Model NGM-222] (1996)[CR]5. Samurai Shodown 64 (1997)[CR]6. Samurai Shodown 64 - Warrior's Rage (1998)[CR]7.
